column3: I will add some more tests later.\n
ping @dooglus: As you are one of the authors of the coin selection code and tests, would you mind giving a concept ACK or concept NACK on this pull?\n
Looks good to me. It makes sense to have the minimum change not be hardcoded to 0.01.\n
Addressed nit by @sipa in follow up commit c3c98ffcb6c27fb836754d54954d2f273928c164.\n
Add mention of the addition of DEFAULT_TRANSACTION_MINFEE to the commit message?\n
@wtogami I think you intended to put the comment over at #6696?\n
Anything holding this back? Does this need more review or additional test cases?\n
@MarcoFalke oh?  it appeared that the commits in this PR added it.\n
Concept ACK. After this we could completely get rid of CENT.\n

If it's a constant, please use an all-upper-case name to make that clear, like MINIMUM_CHANGE.

If you plan to turn it into a runtime variable later, it's probably better to make it a runtime variable immediately now, and initialize it with a constant, for example DEFAULT_MINIMUM_CHANGE.
No plans yet to turn it into a runtime variable.\n
Should use this new default constant in init.cpp as well (e.g. HelpMessage)\n
